intro: Erigeron lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron lemmonii is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
